.class public auto ansi sealed CreateUserErrorEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub CreateUserErrorEventHandler(sender As Object, e As CreateUserErrorEventArgs)
public delegate void CreateUserErrorEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, CreateUserErrorEventArgs ^ e);
type CreateUserErrorEventHandler = delegate of obj * CreateUserErrorEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that handles a event in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserErrorEventHandler> class represents the method that handles the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard.CreateUserError> event in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard> control.
When you create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserErrorEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
